div.head: John Douglass Will
div.p:
Charles County In the name of God Amen.
I John Douglass of Charles County in the province of Maryland
Gentleman being weake of body but of sound and perfect memory
praised be to God for the same doe make and ordaine this my
last will and testament in manner & so following that is to say
first I bequeathmy soule to God from whome I had it hoping one
day to make perfect through the pretious Death and passion of my
dear Saviour Jesus Christ and my body I commit to the earth from
where
where it came to be decently buried at the discression of my Executor hereafter
named.

Imp. It is my will that all my Just Debts and funeral charges be paid and
satisfied Item I give unto my loving son John Douglass five hundred
and fifty acres of land being part of a parcell of land containing one
thousand and fifty acreslaying at Potucent called Cole Spring Manner
when he shall arrive all the age of one and twenty years wth all the
priviledges belonging to that Lord of manner and to his heirs lawfully
to be gather of his body and for the want of such if use my will & pleasure is
that two hundred twenty and five acres the one m of the said five
hundred and fifty acres with that privilege of the manner of the aforesaid desired
unto my loving son Robert Douglass when he shall arrive at the full age
of one and twenty years and the other two hundred and seventy five the m of
Joseph Douglass when twenty one years old.

Item I give unto my loving son Robert Douglass all that parcel of Land called Blute Wood lying in Charles County when he shall arrive at the full age of
one and twenty years.

Item I give unto my loving sons Charles Douglass and Joseph Douglass five
hundred acres of land being the remaining part of one thousand and fifty acres
of Land lying at Petucen called Cole Spring Manner when they shall arrive at the full age of twenty and onen years.

I give unto my dear and loving wife Sarah Douglass all that four hundred
acres of land upon which I now live at Pichiawacon in Charles County to
her and her heirs forever and on for what personal Estate God of his goodness
hath bestowed upon me I give and bequeath unto my dear and loving wife
Sarah Douglass whome I have apponted to be my sole Executor of this my last
will and testament and hereby revoke and make void all wills by me
formally made on witness my hand and seal this fourteenth day of December
in the 3rd year of the Dominion of Charles absolute Lord and propietary of
Maryland
Maryland &c. anno Domino 1678.

Signed Sealed and Published
In the presence of us
Henry Bonner — Francis Pollen — John Robinson
John Douglass

On the back of the aforegoing will of col. John Douglass was thus en.
The within written wil of Col. John Douglass was proved before me in
common form the 27th day of January 1678 by the oaths of Henry
Bonner Francis Pollen and John Robinson witnesses to the same
4 1/4 sides
Benjamin Rozer
